choices.A: Configure an authentication profile on Cisco ISE.
choices.C: Add all authorized admin commands to the TACACS profile.
choices.E: Select "Permit any command that is not listed below" in the TACACS profile.
choices.B: Set Default Privilege to 1 and Maximum Privilege to 15 in the TACACS profile.
choices.D: Set Default Privilege to 15 and Maximum Privilege to 15 in the TACACS profile.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D and E

Selected Answer: DE
D is clear is asking for full privilege out of the box
E is used not to exclude any command

Selected Answer: DE
in the tacacs+ profile to have full access to all commands you must put "Permit any command that is not listed below" and you must set 15 as Default and maximum Privilage

questions.question_text:
An administrator must configure Cisco ISE to authenticate the administrative superuser to manage a Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance firewall. The solution must meet the requirements:

• The user must be authenticated against Microsoft AD.
• The user must have full management administrative access to the Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance firewall.
• The user must not use the enable command.

The configurations were performed:

• joined Cisco ISE to AD and retrieved AD groups
• added the Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance firewall
• enabled Device Admin Service in Cisco ISE
• configured TACACS command sets
• configured a TACACS profile
• configured an authorization policy
• configured the Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance firewall for authentication and authorization

Which two actions must be performed in Cisco ISE? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C.
The key here is nondisruptive.
As soon as you enable SXP, the sw will get all the IP-to-SGT mappings and this could potentially cause issues if for some reason the switch gets the Trustsec policy.

Staging: Add all the AAA+CTS Config (Validate local SGTs)
Pre-prod: Enable SXP to validate the SW is getting all the SGT info Local+SXP (No TrustSec policy)
Prod: Push the TrustSec Policy.

A- makes sense, but in may opinion, if you enable SXP day one could be risky

questions.question_text: An engineer configures Cisco ISE and Cisco Catalyst switches to enforce Cisco TrustSec policies. The engineer must use a nondisruptive deployment approach for new devices by deploying TrustSec policies in staging, preproduction, and production. Which action must be taken to complete the configuration?

choices.B: Configure policy matrices in Cisco ISE and assign the new devices to the policy matrices.
choices.D: Configure a different security group tag for the new devices in the staging, preproduction, and production stages.
choices.A: Configure Security Group Tag Exchange Protocol on the new devices and integrate the devices in groups with Cisco ISE.
choices.C: Integrate the new devices in staging, preproduction, and production network device groups.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
GROUP_ACCOUNTS (default): Sponsors assigned to this group can manage just the guest accounts created by sponsors from the same sponsor group. By default, users in the GROUP_ACCOUNTS user identity group are members of this sponsor

Selected Answer: A
The sponsor need to manage guest accounts created by sponsors from the same sponsor group, should be in GROUP_ACCOUNTS

questions.question_text: A network administrator must restrict sponsor account privileges for managing guest accounts on Cisco ISE for a new account that is being created. Sponsor groups currently exist for each business unit. The new sponsor that is being added must be restricted to only managing guest accounts created by sponsors from the same sponsor group. In which group must the new sponsor account be configured?
An engineer must configure a posture policy with Cisco Temporal Agent workflow. Which two configurations must the engineer apply to meet the requirement? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Configure the Secure Client Posture module.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Correct Answers C and D.
Following Tiberius post, technically speaking A, B, and C are correct.
But you do not need to configure the client provisioning policy, beacuse by default it is already using the Tempora Agent.

Selected Answer: CD
Configure Cisco Temporal Agent Workflow
The process of configuring the Cisco temporal agent involves a series of steps. You should perform the following steps in Cisco ISE.

Procedure

Step 1
Create the posture condition.

Step 2
Create posture requirements.

Step 3
Create the posture policy.

Step 4
Configure the client provisioning policy.

Step 5
Configure authorization profile.
Step 6
Configure authorization policies.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-1/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_3_1/b_ISE_admin_31_compliance.html#AnyConnect_Temporal_Agent_Workflow_For_Windows

questions.question_text: Which command displays all 802.1X/MAB sessions that are active on the switch ports of a Cisco Catalyst switch?

discussion.content: I believe the correct answer is B because the answer that is marked here as correct is for a specific interface while the question states ports (plural)
Correct answer is B

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. when you include a port ID it shows the auth sessions only for that port. without it--all sessions on switch. this is for IBNSv1.0 : IBNSv2.0 command is show access-session

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
It says on switch port(S) not switch port

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer. I tested this on a 3750-X, 3850, and 9300. "Show authentication sessions" shows active sessions on all switchports on the switch. D will show intrerface specific session information.
Reference: 3 different Cisco switches. CLI.

comments.content: Is it because of the plural ports, not the singular port?

discussion.content: Why it's B, the question ask for the authentication on the switchport, isn't it? So D is correct
Correct answer for for ALL sessions (NOT on a specific interface) is B.
Correct answer is B

Selected Answer: B
Answer is BBBBBBBBBBBBB
Why D it's only on the interface?! Wth
B is correct

B = Correct
Exact same question is on the SCOR exam. Actually, about 5-8 questions from this exam are on the SCOR exam. Just passed SCOR today (3rd attempt) and always surprised to see how firewall/ISE questions are on it.
correct answer B
Correct answer is B.

choices.A: show authentication sessions interface Gi1/0/x output
